intro: Tofieldia coccinea var. major, commonly known as the redflower tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and flies. This variety is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ecological benefits and ornamental value.
